intro: Polygala glaziowii, commonly known as the glaziowii milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, compound leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
